item.title: How can I get anti-syi?
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“Kalphiter, post:11, topic:243540”][quote author=The Reaper X link=topic=319856.msg2533787#msg2533787 date=1226623986]

[quote author=needhoster link=topic=319856.msg2533784#msg2533784 date=1226623905]
this it?
[/quote]No, that doesn’t work, don’t listen to Kalphiter lol. He’s missinforming you, although it isn’t his fault. Look at my first post and you’ll see.
[/quote]Seemed to work on my server -.-

And, I posted again.[/quote]It’s just that making your server ban an SYI isn’t going to help.

  1. because SYI just makes multiple accounts, so it’s just going to full your ban.txt with useless stuff

  2. It doesn’t matter if you ban the name or the ip, it still has a chance to open a socket to flood your server with tons of characters

  3. banning them just creates more of a hassle, and making one connection will solve more than the SYI problem, but also stop others from logging into multiple accounts at one time.

Once again, i suggest you refer to this tutorial:

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Read full topic

item.title: How can I get anti-syi?
item.dc:creator: @needhoster needhoster
item.description:
@needhoster wrote:

[quote=“Kalphiter, post:4, topic:243540”][quote author=needhoster link=topic=319856.msg2533763#msg2533763 date=1226623616]

It is quite easy.

The anti-SYI is on most servers, it was just placed incorrectly. It was placed under “Object click two”(or maybe one). It needs to be put under the run() method.
[/quote]uhhh… in english please…? I’m not an expert coder.

find “if.playerName.contains”

Place all the following coding under the run() method, under the ban check is the best place.[/quote]don’t understand sorry but I think i might have it… if(playerName.contains("~") || playerName.contains("!") || playerName.contains("@") || playerName.contains("#") || playerName.contains("$") || playerName.contains("%") || playerName.contains("^") || playerName.contains("&") || playerName.contains("*") || playerName.contains("=") || playerName.contains("+") || playerName.contains(".") || playerName.contains("/") || playerName.contains(",") || playerName.contains("?") || playerName.contains(">") || playerName.contains("<") || playerName.contains("admin") || playerName.contains("owner") || playerName.contains("Admin") || playerName.contains("}") || playerName.contains("{") || playerName.contains("]") || playerName.contains("[") || playerName.contains("-") || playerName.contains("__") || playerName.contains("___") || playerName.contains("____") || playerName.contains("_____") || playerName.contains("SYI") // made by *censored*:) || playerName.contains("SYIpkpker") || playerName.contains("null") || playerName.contains("fuck") || playerName.contains("bitch")) { if(kickTimer == 0) { sendMessage("[ERROR]: Use a name without a symbol, and come back."); this it?

Read full topic

item.title: How can I get anti-syi?
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

refer to Tutorials section before posting next time.

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

[quote=“Kalphiter, post:4, topic:243540”][quote author=needhoster link=topic=319856.msg2533763#msg2533763 date=1226623616]

It is quite easy.

The anti-SYI is on most servers, it was just placed incorrectly. It was placed under “Object click two”(or maybe one). It needs to be put under the run() method.
[/quote]uhhh… in english please…? I’m not an expert coder.

find “if.playerName.contains”

Place all the following coding under the run() method, under the ban check is the best place.[/quote]By the way, that doesn’t work. SYI’s take up sockets, and it has nothing to do with banning names, and preventing them from connecting. They don’t have to connect to crash your server; it’s much more complicated than that.

Read full topic
